intro: Micromeria variegata, commonly known as the variegated micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often variegated, featuring white or green markings, which contribute to its ornamental value. Micromeria variegata is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
